com.mrcrayfish.device.api.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mrcrayfish.device.api.task.Task
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bank.TaskDeposit, Bank.TaskGetBalance, Bank.TaskWithdraw

    public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object

    A Task is simple implementation that allows you to make calls to the server to process actions, store or retrieve data, etc. Useful for any client-server like applications, e.g. Emails, Instant Messaging, etc

    Any global variables that are initialized in this class, wont be on the server side. To initialize them, first store the data in the NBT tag provided in prepareRequest(NBTTagCompound), then once your Task gets to the server, use processRequest(NBTTagCompound, World, EntityPlayer) to get the data from the NBT tag parameter. Initialize the variables as normal.

    Please check out the example applications to get a better understanding how this could be useful to your application.

    • Method Detail

      • setCallback

        public final Task setCallback(Callback callback)
        Sets the callback for task. Used for processing responses, such as updating UI with new data.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback instance for response processing
        Returns:
        this Task instance

      • callback

        public final void callback(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound nbt)

      • setSuccessful

        public final void setSuccessful()
        Sets that this Task was successful. Should be called if your Task produced the correct results, preferably in processRequest(NBTTagCompound, World, EntityPlayer)

      • isSucessful

        public final boolean isSucessful()
        Gets if this Task produced the correct results.
        Returns:
        if this task was successful

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the Task
        Returns:
        the Task name

      • prepareRequest

        public abstract void prepareRequest(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound nbt)
        Called before the request is sent off to the server. You should store the data you want to send into the NBT Tag
        Parameters:
        nbt - The NBT to be sent to the server

      • processRequest

        public abstract void processRequest(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound nbt,
                                    net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                    net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Called when the request arrives to the server. Here you can perform actions with your request. Data attached to the NBT from #prepareRequest() can be accessed from the NBT tag parameter.
        Parameters:
        nbt - The NBT Tag received from the client

      • prepareResponse

        public abstract void prepareResponse(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound nbt)
        Called before the response is sent back to the client. You should store the data you want to send back into the NBT Tag
        Parameters:
        nbt - The NBT to be sent back to the client

      • processResponse

        public abstract void processResponse(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound nbt)
        Called when the response arrives to the client. Here you can update data on the client side. If you want to update any UI component, you should set a Callback before you send the request. See setCallback(Callback)
        Parameters:
        nbt - The NBT Tag received from the server
